thread.title: Chelsea striker tells friends he's set to join Liverpool this summer
thread.title_full: Chelsea striker tells friends he's set to join Liverpool this summer

title: Chelsea striker tells friends he's set to join Liverpool this summer
text:
Chelsea striker tells friends he's set to join Liverpool this summer CHELSEA striker Dominic Solanke is reportedly determined to join Liverpool this summer. PUBLISHED: 23:16, Thu, Feb 16, 2017 | UPDATED: 23:25, Thu, Feb 16, 2017 
Solanke is yet to make a single Premier League appearance for Chelsea under Antonio Conte this season. 
The 19-year-old is billed as one of the Blues' stars of the future after impressing at Dutch side Vitesse Arnhem last term. 
Chelsea want to tie him down to a new contract but are yet to persuade him to stay at Stamford Bridge. Football Manager 2017 wonderkids: 25 strikers you need to sign on FM17 Sat, November 5, 2016 Click through the gallery for a look at 25 wonderkid strikers you need to sign on Football Manager 2017 Getty Images 1 of 26 Click through the gallery for a look at 20 wonderkid strikers you need to sign on Football Manager 2017 GETTY Dominic Solanke has reportedly told friends he's ready to join Liverpool GETTY Dominic Solanke is highly-rated in the Chelsea academy 
And The Sun claim Solanke has told his close friends a summer move to Liverpool is on the cards. 
The youngster wants £50,000 a week to stay at the club but the Blues are reluctant to meet his demands. 
And though Liverpool won't cave in either, the Reds are prepared to offer him first-team football. GETTY Daniel Sturridge could be offloaded in the summer 
Jurgen Klopp is likely to sanction the sale of Daniel Sturridge in the summer and Solanke could be his replacement. 
However, though he would sign on a free transfer in the summer, the deal won't come cheap. 
Liverpool could have to pay up to £8million in compensation via a tribunal after doing the same when they signed Danny Ings from Burnley in 2015. Related articles
